pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:5.1: 2. The training rule on hair on the private parts
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:6.2: At that time the nuns from the group of six removed hair from the private parts. They then bathed naked at a ford in the river Aciravatī together with prostitutes.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:6.3: The prostitutes complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:6.4: “How can the nuns remove hair from the private parts, just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those prostitutes,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:7.3: “How can the nuns from the group of six remove hair from the private parts?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns did that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:7.7: “How can the nuns from the group of six remove hair from the private parts?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:8.1: ‘If a nun removes hair from the private parts, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:11.2: if she removes one hair, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:11.3: Even if she removes many hairs, she commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:12.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:13.1: The second training rule is finished.
